newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony game machine units to be consolidated.
newsitem.headline: Sony game machine units to be consolidated.

text.p: Sony Computer Entertainment Inc (SCE), a subsidiary of Sony Corp, said on Monday that Sony's game machine units in the United States and Europe would be consolidated under its management.

The stakes in the units -- Sony Computer Entertainment America, Sony Interactive Studio America, Sony Computer Entertainment Europe and sales firms for Sony's PlayStation game console in Europe -- would be transferred to SCE from Sony Corp of America, SCE said in a statement.
The move is expected to be completed by the end of January, the statement said.
The new SCE group's total sales in the 1996/97 business year are expected to reach 340 billion yen, the statement said.

PlayStation made its debut in Japan in December 1994 and was introduced in the United States and Europe in September 1995. The game machine's accumulative sales reached 10 million units by the end of November 1996.

A SCE spokesman also said that the company plans to start manufacturing 32-bit PlayStation game machines at a new Sony factory in Mexico in mid-1997. The game machines will be supplied to the North American market, he said.
